title: Oricat's Author Page
content:
[[>]]
[[module rate]]
[[/>]]
-----

My works on the site, in (roughly) alphabetical order:

* [http://www.scp-wiki.net/scp-4528 Accendium Lucia (4528)]
* [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/an-anthropological-approach-to-sarkicism-case-study-04-house An Anthropological Approach to Sarkicism - Case Study 04: House Kurinuka] (co-authored with [[*user Indices]])
* [http://www.scp-wiki.net/breathe-on-me Breathe on Me]
* [http://www.scp-wiki.net/death-and-the-women Death and the Women]
* [http://www.scp-wiki.net/scp-5737 Entheogen (5737, 5000 contest entry)]
* [http://www.scp-wiki.net/et-sanabitur-anima-mea et sanábitur ánima mea]
* [http://www.scp-wiki.net/ever-only-all Ever, Only, All]
* [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/i-say-this-that-you-suffer i say this that you suffer]
* Kadakúni
 * [http://www.scp-wiki.net/light-of-the-north Light of the North, Or the Three Impossible Tasks of Te̮la]
 * [http://www.scp-wiki.net/suekni-and-the-firebird Sükni and the Firebird]
 * [http://www.scp-wiki.net/the-catching-of-the-sun The Catching of the Sun]
* Klavigar Character Studies
 * [http://www.scp-wiki.net/tuae Tuae]
 * [http://www.scp-wiki.net/such-a-world-as-this Such A World As This]
 * [http://www.scp-wiki.net/and-the-fact-it-rains and the fact it rains]
 * [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/poisoned-honey Poisoned Honey]
 * [http://www.scp-wiki.net/elae Elä]
* [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/of-saarn-and-the-ozirmok Of Saarn and the Ozirmok]
* [https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6028 Unprecedented Times (6028, 6000 contest entry)] (co-authored with [[*user Indices]])
* [http://www.scp-wiki.net/unto-the-ages Unto the Ages]

Commentary on said works, if you wish to read it:
[[collapsible]]
* Ever, Only, All: This was my first work on the site - literally 6000+ words recapping what I know about evolutionary history so far, as seen through Bronze Age eyes. Slightly Granola Sarkic, looking backwards.
* Kadakúni tales: Another internet writer, [https://fialleril.tumblr.com/tagged/tatooine-slave-culture fialleril], developed an AU culture for Star Wars Tatooine. I decided that I wanted one of those things for myself, so I made one.
* Klavigar Character Studies: Second-person point of view is difficult to pull off, sometimes, but I do think it serves well for characters that occupy a somewhat mythical role, where first-person would feel too intimate and grandiose, while third-person would feel too cold and would not permit the reporting of private thoughts and feelings.
[[/collapsible]]
